natural problem: Let $P_0(x) = x^3 + 313x^2 - 77x - 8\,$. For integers $n \ge 1\,$, define $P_n(x) = P_{n - 1}(x - n)\,$. What is the coefficient of $x\,$ in $P_{20}(x)\,$?
natural solution: We have \[\begin{aligned} P_1(x) &= P_0(x-1), \\ P_2(x) &= P_1(x-2) = P_0(x-2-1), \\ P_3(x) &= P_2(x-3) = P_0(x-3-2-1), \end{aligned}\]and so on.

We see that \[\begin{aligned} P_{20}(x) &= P_0(x-20-19-\dots-2-1) \\ &= P_0(x - 210), \end{aligned}\]using the formula $20 + 19 + \cdots + 2 + 1 = \tfrac{20(21)}{2} = 210.$ Thus, \[P_{20}(x) = (x-210)^3 + 313(x-210)^2 - 77(x-210) - 8.\]The coefficient of $x$ in this polynomial is \[\begin{aligned} 3 \cdot 210^2 - 313 \cdot 2 \cdot 210 - 77& = 210(3 \cdot 210 - 313 \cdot 2) - 77 \\ &= 210(630 - 626) - 77 \\ &= 210 \cdot 4 - 77 \\ &= \boxed{763}.

shows  "coeff (P 20 x) x = 763"
